output_data.clarification_question: To solidify the diagnosis of Major Depressive Disorder, recurrent episode, moderate (F33.1), please confirm the full A-criteria count (5 or more symptoms of depression/anhedonia), the duration of the current episode, and whether the patient has a confirmed history of previous Major Depressive Episodes.
output_data.suggested_answer: Given the recent initiation of *Sertraline* 50mg, the most clinically probable answer is that the patient met full A-criteria (>5 symptoms for >2 weeks) and has a known history of previous depressive episodes, supporting the provisional F33.1.

primary_diagnosis.description: Major depressive disorder, recurrent episode, moderate
primary_diagnosis.justification: This code is assigned provisionally based on the clinical context provided by the User Feedback (initiation of *Sertraline* 50mg four weeks prior), which is standard treatment for this disorder. The 'recurrent' specifier is assumed based on the common practice of confirming past episodes before initiating pharmacotherapy.
dsm_criteria_met: Presumed A-criteria (5/9 symptoms) met for the current episode.
Presumed history of at least one previous Major Depressive Episode.

ruled_out.description: Major depressive disorder, single episode, moderate
ruled_out.reason: Ruled out in favor of F33.1 based on common clinical practice suggesting a history of recurrence when initiating treatment in this context.
While *Sertraline* treats GAD, the initial provisional assessment pointed toward MDD (F33.1) as the primary diagnosis. Cannot rule out GAD as a secondary diagnosis without further screening.
